results.title: The Old man and the sea
results.creator_credit: Judd Taylor, Robert E. Fuisz, William F Storke and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: A stunning dramatisation of Hemingway’s epic tale of struggle between man and nature. Anthony Quinn stars as Santiago, whose encounter with a giant Marlin becomes a fight for survival as a band of sharks move in for the kill. Filmed on location on the British Virgin Islands, this film combines action-packed excitement with outstanding human drama.

results.title: Nothing sacred
results.creator_credit: William Wellman, David O. Selznick and Selznick International Pictures
results.brief_description: Carol Lombard is hilariously funny playing the role of Hazel Flagg in this outstanding black comedy. Hazel’s bumbling doctor mistakenly diagnoses her as having fatal radium poisoning. Although she’s never felt better, Hazel pretends to be dying in order to accept the offer of an all-expenses-paid visit to New York City made by a newspaper reporter. By the time the reporter begins churning out daily reports of the tragedy, half of Manhattan is in tears and Hazel is built up to be a brave ‘suffering in silence’ charmer and is lionized by the media and public. When Hazel cannot disguise her good health any longer, a group of her financial backers wise up to her ruse and ask her to find a way to die and save them all further embarassment.This was one of the first screwball comedies ever produced, and possibly one of the finest.

results.title: Never cry wolf
results.creator_credit: Carroll Ballard, Joseph Strick, Jack Couffer, Lewis Allen and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: In the Arctic region wolves are suspected of contributing to the diminishing number of caribou herds. “The Lupine project” is established by the government to investigate and observe wolves to provide concrete evidence of their aggressive nature. A young biologist, Tyler (Charles Martin Tyler), is left alone in the unfriendly Arctic wilderness to conduct such a study where he must contend with the forces of nature to discover as much as he can about the canis lupis; the wolf. Based on Farley Mowat’s autobiographical novel of the same name, screenplay by Curtis Hanson. Also starring Brian Dennehy.

results.title: The Emerald forest
results.creator_credit: John Boorman and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Based on a true story of American engineer Bill Markham (Powers Boothe), whose son is kidnapped while working in Brazil. His son is kidnapped by a tribe called “The Invisible people”, due to their ability to camouflage. Despite the authorities giving up the search, Markham and a French photographer continue the search, until the photographer is killed and the father must go on alone. Cast also includes Meg Foster, Charley Boorman and Rui Polonah. Made in the Amazon rainforest and written by Rospo Pallenberg.

results.title: Marked woman
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Bacon, Jack L. Warner, Hal B. Wallis, Louis F. Edelman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A hard boiled B-girl (Bette Davis), is determined to turn the tables on Mobster Johnny Vanning (Eduardo Ciannelli), who has recently taken over the management of the nightclub where she works and is attempting to turn out the current employees. It proves to be hard task for one individual so she enlists the help of a district attorney (Bogart), and her fellow workers at the nightclub (Rosalind Marquis, Lola Lane, Isabel Jewell and Mayo Methot). This film is based on the trial of New York Gangster Lucky Luciano, sent to prison on the basis of evidence from prostitutes.

results.title: Heart condition
results.creator_credit: James D. Parriott, Steve Tisch and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A tough cop and a cunning lawyer begin an unlikely alliance when they partner up to find a murderer. Mooney (Bob Hoskins), a tough and bigoted cop suffers a near fatal heart attack while on the job. His life is saved by a successful heart transplant, courtesy of the recently assassinated lawyer, Stone (Denzel Washington). There is only one unexpected side effect from the operation; Stone’s ghost accompanies the transplanted organ. They discover they share more than the operation in common when it transpires that Stone’s hooker girlfriend is the former girlfriend of Mooney. The two have different priorities however, and while Mooney wants to regain his former girlfriend, Stone wants to find his killer, making for a confusion between body and mind. Also starring Chloe Webb.

results.title: The Muppet movie
results.creator_credit: James Frawley, Jim Henson and ITC Entertainment
results.brief_description: Kermit the Frog has finally hit the big time and he’s heading for Hollywood. With his fellow Muppets including Miss Piggy, Gonzo, Animal, Fozzie Bear, plus the rest of the Muppet Performers, they encounter real life stars along the way. Kermit begins his journey on a humble bicycle, but as the passengers accumulate along the way his means of transport increases in size. Kermit also has to contend with the slimy Doc Hopper who is eager for Kermit to promote fried frog legs, as well as his strong feelings for Miss Piggy. Features a number of cameos as well as paying homage to several classic films.

results.title: Greyfriars Bobby: the true story of a dog
results.creator_credit: Don Chaffey and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the children’s book by Eleanor Atkinson, this delightful movie tells the story of a lovable and faithful terrier named Bobby. Bobby is owned by the family at Cauldbrae Farm, but he chooses his own master in “Old Jock”(Alex Mackenzie), caretaker at the farm. When Jock dies, Bobby remains steadfast in his refusal to leave his master’s gravesite at the estate where he worked. The new caretaker of the farm, James Brown (Donald Crisp), is not keen about having Bobby forced on him but the dog manages to work his way into his heart. Set against the picturesque Scottish countryside this film also stars Laurence Naismith and Kay Walsh and is a remake of “A Challenge to Lassie”.

results.title: The Phantom tollbooth
results.creator_credit: Abe Levitow, Chuck Jones and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A young boy, (Butch Patrick) dreams away his boredom by entering an animated fantasy world which he enters by driving through the Phantom Tollbooth. In this world letters and numbers are at war with one another, and the boy must rescue two Princesses, Rhyme and Reason who have been exiled to a castle hovering in the sky. Based on Norton Juster’s book, this film is MGM’s first full-length feature cartoon. Voices provided by Mel Blanc, June Foray and Daws Butler

results.title: Immortal beloved [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rose, Bruce Davey and ICON
results.brief_description: When a cryptic letter from musical genius, Beethoven, turned up shortly after his death, it started one of history’s most compelling romantic mysteries. An enduring riddle that remains unsolved to this day. Who, among the scores of women that Beethoven seduced, was his “Immortal Beloved”? Gary Oldman and Isabella Rossellini share a love as hypnotic as the music Beethoven created, in this enthralling film based on the celebrated life of one of the greatest composers that ever lived.
